Reviews.Content: Loved Torre Bellosguardo -- but be advised !!!! Prior to making a reservation, I contacted the hotel and asked them to make sure that they could accommodate our request ... primarily, that is was accessible for someone with minor physical limitations ... the room they gave us had a small platform bed, the worst nightmare for someone who gets up in the night ... Additionally, they appeared not to have the reservation for the party we were travelling with even though the deposit had been charged to the credit card and paid. After a minor hassle, they gave them a room that apparently was an upgrade. Without warning, they were charged significantly more, even though the mistake was the hotel's. The hotel is a destination in and of itself and we thoroughly enjoyed the building, gardens and the magnificent views and wonderful peaceful atmosphere. However, service and maintenance is lacking. The breakfast was expensive and not as good as it could have been. We loved the location; being able to experience this magnificent Florentine villa was such a privilege; however, this wonderful place needs maintenance and better services that it and its customers deserve.
Reviews.Author: xshill

Reviews.Content: enchanting stay Stayed 5 days with 2 kids 5 and 8 last November but have stayed many times before. It is one of the most beautiful property in Florence, as it is so nice to be up on a hill yet so close to the center through Porta Romana, a delightful walk away (need a lift to go back though).Yes it is shabby chic, a little run down, but that is why we love returning to Bellosguardo, it is like returning to your own family property...the owner just built a huge indoor pool (although a bit cold to my taste), it is incredible to have such views once you have gone through impressive underground stairs...no restaurant but the adorable staff will have the next door trattoria deliver for you.
Reviews.Author: ParisFrenchie

Reviews.Content: great views, old world charm, rip-off breakfast Torre Bellosguardo is a privately owned, beautiful Medieval Villa operating as a discreet hotel. Don't come here if you expect in your face, 5 star service though.Ambience wise, you feel like you are the weekend guest at a very special arisocratic home. There are very few staff around, and at times you feel like you own the place. The uniqueness and beauty of the surroundings will charm most people.The biggest let down was breakfast. It is not included in the cost of the room and at 25 euro, is grossly overpriced. You could expect a better breakfast at a two star hotel and you probably wouldn't have to pay for it!!
Reviews.Author: Marcus0207

Reviews.Content: Stunning location if only the service matched it! We spent 3 nights at Bellosguardo - what a stunning location. This was let down by the overpriced rooms, most of which seemed as is they hadnt been invested in for years; and the unhelpful staff. To pay 350 euros for a room I wouldnt then expect to be charged extra for a bottle of water left at the bedside, nor would I expect to have to pay extra in order to use the indoor swimming pool. Breakfast (at an additional cost I hasten to add) is comparable to what you would expect at a 2 / 3 star hotel - pastries and fruit in a basket. Staff made us feel as if we were an inconvenience (with the exception of the chambermaids who were delightful). The place also has a really nasty mosquito population.
Reviews.Author: Hollydrinks

Reviews.Content: Romantic, Medieval Honeymoon       The view from our room.
Reviews.Author: decafisevil

Reviews.Content: Casa Rosa, an apartment at Torre di Bellosguardo was a home away from home       Walkway to Casa Rosa and pathway from hotel
Reviews.Author: SusanCD

Reviews.Content: Magical experience My husband and I stayed here for a weekend with our twin sons and booked directly with the hotel. We were allocated a suite on the top floor overlooking Florence. (Room 14.) We didn't have the high ceilings of the first floor but we had the peace and quiet, being at the top of the hotel. The boys had their own beds made-up in the sitting room, so we all slept so well. The hotel sits on a hill overlooking the city with absolutely glorious views of Florence, including the Duomo. The gardens and location are just superb and the palazzo itself is magical. All the staff were incredibly courteous and helpful.It has to be one of my favourite hotels in the world; I have travelled a lot and am also quite particular. The bedrooms and reception rooms are full of lovely old pieces of furniture but don't expect perfection. The sheets are cotton and there was plenty of hot water but if you mind about creeking floorboards and the odd spider web - you would be missing a magical experience but would be happier in a five star in the centre.Finally, if you do not have your own car, you will need to be prepared to pay for taxis. The drive into the centre is about 10 mins. (The walk down to the centre is not particularly special and totally exhausting walking back up!)
Reviews.Author: LizzieandFred

Reviews.Content: Lovely Gardens and View       The pool
Reviews.Author: volcanolover

Reviews.Content: old fashioned charm we have stayed in Florence over the years several times always in the centre of town and always just before or after the summer to avoid the great heat and crowds. Two years ago we were recommended this hotel by friends who are long time customers. The most obvious bonus of the hotel is the view which by our experience is by far the best over the city. The grounds also are very special, a calm oasis of tranquillity to return to after a whole day of plodding round town. We were probably expecting more luxury in the typical sense, with lots of staff and trendy details. Bellosguardo is not that. But if one can do without that and understand the spirit of the place then its a great stay. We hope our advice can be useful to those wanting to stay there. If you are looking for the hip and contemporary then it's not for you. But if you like the bucolic, old english country home charm, then coupled with the view and the impressive rooms, it is abosilutely the place for you! Prices by Italian standards are more than adequate.
Reviews.Author: florencegoer

Reviews.Content: A great holiday       the hotel
Reviews.Author: Isa_s

Reviews.Content: a room with a view Recently stayed at Bellosguardo for five nights and fell in love with the place. Spectacular views, beautiful gardens, spacious rooms decorated with antique furniture and very helpful staff. You feel you are staying in a private villa. Very romantic and a welcome change from your usual hotel. has no restaurant but there's a wonderful trattoria five minutes away. I'll be going back.
Reviews.Author: m-maylis

Reviews.Content: Heaven!!!!       Torre di Bellosguardo
Reviews.Author: VioletaSevilla

Reviews.Content: Dont fall into the trap of booking Ok... its has the most amazing views of Florence, an excellent pool and the potential to be one of the great hotles in the world. But dont fall into the trap i did of booking because of this and ignoring the other reviews. The service was at best average, with the staff hardly around to help. we were there for three nights. on our second day a US TV crew truned up and took over most of the hotel shooting a TV advert. there were no apologies from the hotel for our incovenience, although after i complained they offered us a free lunch. My new wife and I both got massive mosquito bites (although interesting to read other review about bed bugs!). On our third day we returned at 5pm to find we had been kicked out of our room because they thought we had booked for two nights only. not only did we feel that we had been robbed - as they invaded our privacy and moved all our stuff - but there was almost no apology when i showed them the paper work and their confirmation of our 3 night booking. Eventualy i pressed them for a solution and some compensation and they found what was probably the worst room in the hotel FOC. I wouldnt recomeedn going there to anyone until it has been taken over by someone willing to invest in the fixtures and fittings and also the staff resource (i dont blame the individuals involved themslevs because they were hugley overworked/understaffed). despite what is says on the website it is a hike into Florence not by any stretch of the imagination a walk.
Reviews.Author: HBOMBLondinium

Reviews.Content: What a rip off!! We have just returned from a weekend at the hotel with several friends. The rooms are old and dirty. The carpet in ours was flithy and the curtains mouldy. The service is non-exsistent. The property is beautiful on the outside, but very disappointing on the inside and the rates are totally overpriced. You can do much better round the corner!!
Reviews.Author: Burmadutch

Reviews.Content: Worst hotel in 20 yrs. of travel! This hotel boasts a scenic view and that is all to recommend it. Our room didn't lock, was dim, had extremely old furnishings, and a very small bathroom. There is no food or beverage service. You must order several hours in advance. There is nothing within walking distance so you must call a cab or, if you have a car, drive down a winding, perilous driveway to get to the city. We complained to management about our door and the manager claimed to lock it. but it was open when we returned from dinner. During a sleepness nite, I could hear people behind our door and bats overhead. We checked out in the a.m. but the management kept our deposit. We located a wonderful hotel that day that was half the cost and convenient to everything. We have traveled extensively and this was the worst hotel experience for us.
Reviews.Author: aries410

Reviews.Content: exceptional holiday Following advice of friends i contacted and booked directly this hotel for me, my husband and children. We spent three heavenly days there, a wonderful very original hotel. The staff were exceptionally helpful and did everything to make us feel at home. A hotel definitely to be recommended especially if one is looking for peace, beauty and fleeing all the noise and caos of the city of Florence, which in any case is only a five minute taxi ride away.
Reviews.Author: irenePortimao

Reviews.Content: Needs some real improvements The view : nothing to say, it's just fantastic.The calm : yes, no doubt it really quiet.The service : near zero. No joke. Appart from the reception, you hardly see anyone (some might say it's perfect...).- At the pool, a very nice guy (truely), but apparently never worked in this business before.- At breakfast, once you've been served, hope nothing's missing, 'cause they're gone away !The hotel : it's kind of oldy... but not the good part of it :- gardens : are nice, but starts to be abandoned in some places- reception room : nice place, but would definitly need some more furniture- breakfast room : nothing appart from chairs and tables. Wanted to have it outside (on a nice sunny day) ? Then tables are so low your knees won't fit under...- rooms : we had the little suite. Really nice. Bed was great. Furniture is ok and authentic. Bathroom is perfect.- would you say it's normal that a EUR 20 breakfast is 1 croissant + 1 piece of bread + 1 tea (lipton...) + 1 orange juice ? Surely not. This kind of place could afford a beeter tea, a little more ingredients... even if price is to be much higher !Definitly a place that must have been wonderfull and that is slowly but surely falling appart.
Reviews.Author: Ericm123

Reviews.Content: A big disappointment! My husband and I traveled to Italy in celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary in June 2006. I researched our accommodations extensively and selected Torre di Bellosguardo for our four nights in Florence because of raves about its location and as a romantic indulgence. We began our trip in Venice and then traveled by train to Florence, arriving at Torre di Bellosguardo on the afternoon of our anniversary. As many others have stated, the villa and its grounds are beautiful and the view of Florence from the pool and from our room was exquisite. Only because the hotel is so exceptionally lovely is this not a completely unfavorable review.Unfortunately, the incredible location and inherent advantages of this lovely, historic building are not matched by the service. We found the men who manned the front desk and who had apparent responsibility for responding to guest inquiries to be indifferent and seemingly aggravated by even simple requests. It seemed as if just about everything was either beneath them or too much trouble. Similarly, on the two mornings we went to breakfast on the covered loggia, the setting was lovely, but the service was chaotic, if sincere. One or two young girls were apparently racing back and forth between the terrace and some room at least two floors above carrying identical items to each table. It took forever, even for the continental breakfast, and we felt sorry for the overheated girls and the completely disorganized scheme they seemed compelled to follow. The last straw, however, was the recognition, on the morning of our departure, that the very itchy rashes we had developed during our time in Florence and attributed to a change in detergent, perhaps, was in fact bedbug bites! Call us slow on the uptake, but neither of us had ever had an experience of this and so we didn't recognize the signs--or maybe we just didn't want to believe that something so unpleasant could be happening in an expensive hotel. We assume the bedbugs were living in the upholstered headboard of our room's antique bed. Really repulsed, we were relieved to be heading off to Rome that day.This hotel has the location and physical plant to be one of the extraordinary small hotels of the world. Perhaps someone who understands how to run a fine hotel will upgrade the service to match the location and the rates that this place charges.
Reviews.Author: TravelerNewJersey

Reviews.Content: 7th visit in 15 years! We just keep going back to this magical place, and the price be hanged! It costs a fortune to maintain and we are happy to contribute. Besides, it feels like home. We know all the staff now, not to mention the cats and the donkey. We have seen the care and maintenance over the years, the development of the gardens, spa and underground parking garage. We have tried other hotels in Florence, usually scruffy, so when we are travelling alone, or with friends who don't mind forking out a little more for accommodation, we come here.There is just no other place like it in the world - it is absolutely unique. Highly recommended for the imaginative traveller.
Reviews.Author: HEJ1949

Reviews.Content: Not what we expected The Hotel as a building cannot be faulted ... it is truly stunning. However the combination of a lack of air conditionning and no nets or screens on the windows led us to a week of very little sleep - open windows attracted the mozzies, whilst closed ones enclosed the stifling heat. We suffered alternate nights of over heating and mozzie attacks, dependent on which evil we decided to give into. There also seemed to be a problem with understaffin, and their service was very hit and miss. Some staff were great but others weren't. The lack of staff meant that often the pool bar was unmanned during the heat of the afternoon, and service in the hotel bar appeared to de dependent on whether the receptionist had time to leave their desk or not. Not a great impression for guests. Also, we were told that we could have food brought up from the local restaurant by ordering it through reception, but the one night that we decided to avail of this service we were told that we were too late (8pm). Apparently another room had already ordered food and a hotel staff member had just left to collect their order, and he wouldn't go back for us. There was a taxi strike in Florence and it was a long steep walk to the nearest retaurant and back! Being pregnant and overheated I gave dinner a miss instead. Any other hotel I've been to would have done their best to accomodate us, but not the Bellosguardo. It's not as if we got the rooms on any deal off the internet - we paid the full rate. I've stayed in great hotels and one or two dreadful ones but this one falls somewhere in between, thanks to the lack of air con and the patchy service. I'll not be back, and I'll not be recommending it to anyone either.
Reviews.Author: Ash1971

Reviews.Content: Absolutely enchanting This is an enchanting paradise on earth. It's very luxurious and comfortable without being needlessly opulent. The views are magical, the gardens are exquisite and the welcome is very warm. This is a fantastic place from which to enjoy Florence and allows you to escape from the tourists and the noise in the evenings.
Reviews.Author: Thackers

Reviews.Content: Great views, long walk to town
Reviews.Author: Aeryn

Reviews.Content: Truly a unique experience From the moment you drive up the hill and see the amazing view of Florence and this stunning ancient building you know this is going to be something special. The place is enormous yet it only has 16 guest rooms, a small bar one person at the desk at a time to help and yes they are very helpful. If you need a dinner recommendation or a taxi , they even made us reservations at some of the museums. You kind of feel like you are visiting a very rich friend rather than staying in a hotel . Our bedroon was great with a view of Florence that could take your breath away and the hills of Tuscany, nice bathroom, direct dial phone, very nice. The surrounding area of the hotel is called Oltrando and it has some really charming spots, our favorite restaurant Vecchia Bettola is at the bottom of the hill or if you want to go to the center of Florence a good walk in the daylight about a half an hour. Only complaint is that we took alot of taxi's especially at night, very narrow,dark road up to hotel but it was all worth it since it made our trip to Florence memorable and would love to visit Torre di Bellosguardo again. P.S. the gardens are magical, every time we walked through them we discvovered something new, you have to see them for yourself...
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Stunning place We love this hotel. The gardens are enchanting and the villa itself feels like you are a guest of some past century count. Most bedrooms are enormous with high ceilings. Michele is a fun, kind and effective host. The furniture is a bit tattered but it adds to the charm.This is not a place for people who demand Four Seasons service. The furniture is not new and perfectly coordinated. If you want something from the bar, you have to go to the person at the front desk who leaves his post to get you a drink. There is not the buzz of lots of staff running around waiting on people. Additionally, it is an ancient tower so it can feel dark. Notwithstanding all this, it is an authentic, gorgeous place.The views of Florence below and the Duomo in particular are the best I have ever seen. It is true that the hotel is a 10 minute drive outside of the city but its neighborhood and setting are stunning to say the least.
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Unbelievable Views and Gorgeous Gardens Outstanding location in the hills above Florence. The villa itself is lovely. The gardens are worth walking through over and over again. We had two toddlers with us and they loved the nearly magical gardens with the waterfalls, creeks and cats meandering through the lavender. It was close enough to the city to enjoy it (about a 10 euro cabfare), and the hotel is good about getting you a cab quickly when you need it. It is difficult to catch a cab coming back, but you'll eventually find a restaurant host who is willing to call one for you. The views are worth the price of admission...it had to be the most beautiful view we had of Italy and we'd traveled quite a bit. Be there at sunset to see the changing colors of the Tuscan hills!!The only downside...the beds were not comfortable. We were in a gorgeous, antique royal looking bed, but it was a miserable night's sleep. I understand that many rooms have newer beds...request one. The older, charming looking ones are terrible. We ended up having our children sleep in it and we preferred the pull out bed in the couch. Seriously...that was a better night's sleep than the bed.Oh, and they will make you a light pasta meal if necessary, although they don't have a full restaurant. It was good enough for us when we were tired and did not feel like venturing into town.
Reviews.Author: paris4awhile

Reviews.Content: Stunning stay! We booked our stay in Florence because of the reviews on trip advisor for this hotel and were not disappointed. It was truly amazing. The atmosphere in the villa was hushed but not stuffy. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the views from the bedroom breathtaking. We enjoyed the walk down through the gardens to the city and would then return by taxi late at night.A romantic and memorable place to visit and we can't wait to return.
Reviews.Author: tpadvisorwalker

Reviews.Content: What an experience.. what a view.. what a price!!!       Quaint little bathroom
Reviews.Author: Claire_Napier

Reviews.Content: Was that real or a fairy tale? This is truly a magical place. The views from the hillside of Florence are incredible and the hotel itself is a beautiful edifice. The distance to the Duomo is roughly a 30 minute walk so be prepared to bring your walking shoes or to take taxis to town. I'll certainly return the next time I'm in Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful place, but just a little too far from the town This is wonderful quiet place, outside of Florence the views and grounds were amazing. The hotel something out of movie, as beautiful inside as it is outside. The web site can answer most questions, I'm not sure it said charged says they charge an additional 30 Euros per person if you wanted to use the wellness center. Also consider you need to take a taxi to and from town, about 10+ Euro each way. Price per night 280 Euro per night. Again real quiet, not a good place for children. (No TV)
Reviews.Author: mcwell14

Reviews.Content: The name says it all From the time you drive through the gates into the grounds of this villa just 10 minutes from the center of Florence and follow the crushed stone driveway to the impressive entrance to the villa itself, you know that you have arrived at someplace special. Check-in is at a desk just off an impressive hallroom, one that appears to have been preserved just the way it was originally centuries ago. Bellosguardo promises a beautiful view and indeed, there is no finer view of Florence from the immaculate and spacious grounds of this villa. Florence is a city whose beauty is best appreciated from a distance. Open a window from a guest room and it appears that you could reach out and touch the red-tiled rooftops of Florence. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, with antique touches to them. The internal public spaces are rich with antiquity and extend out to beautiful gardens where one's privacy is rarely imposed upon. With only a dozen or so rooms, you can feel at times that there is no one else sharing that space with you. Breakfast is served on a terrace overlooking distant Tuscan hills, and lunch at poolside, where a spectacular view of Florence provides a perfect backdrop on a sunny summer's day. Dinner is not provided at the hotel, but with all of that which Florence has to offer, this was never a problem. It was more like being at home for the morning, and heading out for exploration and shopping in Florence in the afternoon, topped by dinner in the evening. Bellosguardo offers a sense of civility and exclusivity that one rarely finds at hotels, yet the service is genuinely friendly and down to earth. I find myself wanting to return to Florence for as much as what Bellosguardo has to offer as the city itself.
Reviews.Author: finaljudgment

Reviews.Content: Errol Flynn Never Had It So Good On a hill overlooking the city's medieval towers, at the top of twisting narrow cobblestone roads, there's a small castle like luxury hotel that is peaceful and quiet and, believe it or not, like stepping back in time. A walk to your room makes you think Errol Flynn stayed here. After a busy day in town, seeing all the sights, enjoying a wonderful dinner, this is the place to come home to. Here, you and someone you care about (immensely) can fall into each other's arms under a canopied bed behind ancient and huge wooden doors. Words can not describe it adequately. My wife loved the work out area, but I loved the scenery and views, the garden, and the pool. We came across this place by accident and fell in love with it before ever staying there. Staying there only fulfilled the dream. Now we can't wait to go back.
Reviews.Author: RonDayton
